clans.name: Ashanti (Asante)
clans.description: One of the most powerful kingdoms in African history, known for their gold wealth and military prowess.
traditions: The Golden Stool is the sacred symbol of the Ashanti nation
Kente cloth originated from Ashanti weavers
Adinkra symbols carry deep philosophical meanings

clans.name: Yoruba
clans.description: One of Africa's largest ethnic groups, known for their sophisticated civilization, art, and religious traditions.
traditions: Orisha worship spread to the Americas through the diaspora
Yoruba bronze sculptures are UNESCO recognized
Ile-Ife is considered the spiritual homeland

clans.name: Zulu
clans.description: The largest ethnic group in South Africa, known for their warrior tradition and rich cultural heritage.
traditions: The Zulu Kingdom was founded by King Shaka
Reed Dance ceremony celebrates womanhood
Beadwork carries coded messages about relationships

clans.name: Igbo
clans.description: Known as one of Africa's most entrepreneurial peoples, with a democratic village-based society.
traditions: Democratic 'Oha' council system governed communities
New Yam Festival (Iri ji) celebrates harvest
Igbo art includes elaborate masks and textiles

clans.name: Maasai
clans.description: Semi-nomadic pastoralists known for their distinctive customs, dress, and warrior traditions.
traditions: Cattle are central to Maasai life and wealth
Adumu (jumping dance) is performed by warriors
Red shuka cloth and beadwork are iconic

clans.name: Wolof
clans.description: The largest ethnic group in Senegal, known for their griots (storytellers) and hospitality traditions.
traditions: Teranga (hospitality) is central to Wolof culture
Griots preserve history through oral tradition
Sabar drumming accompanies ceremonies

clans.name: Hausa-Fulani
clans.description: A major cultural and political force in West Africa, with a long history of trade and Islamic scholarship.
traditions: Durbar festival features horsemen in ceremonial dress
Islamic scholarship centers like Kano are historic
Hausa architecture features distinctive mud-brick designs

clans.name: Akan
clans.description: A major ethnic group encompassing Ashanti, Fante, and others, known for their matrilineal society.
traditions: Day names given based on birthday
Gold weights were used as currency
Adinkra symbols carry philosophical meanings

surnames.meaning: Derived from 'William', commonly assigned during slavery
